question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy()] [Ray Math Overflow] At line 165, ray_mul with MsPerYear (31536000000) multiplied by a large incentive amount—can this cause overflow in ray math if the incentive amount is extremely large? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy_one()] [Ray Math Underflow] At lines 236-245, if total_incentive_amount_on_usd is very small relative to protocol_total_supply_on_usd, can the ray_div result in underflow or near-zero values that incorrectly show 0% APY? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy()] [Precision Loss Accumulation] At line 170, 'total_apy = total_apy + apy' accumulates APY across multiple pools—can rounding errors in individual pool APY calculations compound to significant total APY errors? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Mutable Storage Access] At line 39, storage::get_user_balance takes '&mut Storage'—if this function modifies storage state (e.g., accrues interest), can calling get_incentive_pools inadvertently change user balances as a side effect? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy()] [Mutable Storage Modification] At line 102, storage::get_reserves_count and line 105 storage::get_total_supply both take '&mut Storage'—can these view functions modify storage state, causing unexpected state changes during read operations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Storage Race Condition] At line 304, storage::get_user_balance is called inside a loop—if another transaction modifies user balance between iterations, can this cause inconsistent pool info across different pools in the same query? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Storage State Inconsistency] At line 306, storage::get_total_supply is called repeatedly in a loop—if total supply changes mid-execution due to concurrent deposits/withdrawals, can this cause different pools to show inconsistent reward calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy_one()] [Storage Mutation Risk] At line 211, storage::get_total_supply with mutable reference—if this accidentally modifies state, can it affect subsequent operations or violate view function guarantees? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Option Type Confusion] At lines 42-44, if option == incentive::option_borrow(), total_supply_balance is reassigned to total_borrow_balance—if option value is manipulated or incorrectly passed, can this cause wrong balance to be used in reward calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy()] [Borrow/Supply Confusion] At lines 106-108, total_supply is conditionally set to total_borrow based on option—if option is not properly validated, can supply pool rewards be calculated using borrow amounts, inflating or deflating APY incorrectly? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Option Matching Bypass] At lines 290-293, pools are filtered by option_type—if a pool's option field doesn't match expected values, can it bypass filtering and show incorrect incentive data to users? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_apy_one()] [Option Type Missing] At line 212, option is used to conditionally set protocol_total_supply to borrow balance—if the option field from pool info is corrupt or uninitialized, can this cause wrong supply value to be used? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Factor Manipulation] At line 64, incentive::calculate_user_effective_amount uses factor from pool info—if factor can be set to extreme values (very large or very small), can this artificially inflate or deflate user rewards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Factor Overflow] At line 311, user_effective_amount calculation with factor—if factor is u256 max or very large, can multiplication overflow in the effective amount calculation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Factor Zero] At line 64, if factor is 0, can calculate_user_effective_amount return 0 for all users, causing all users to receive 0 rewards regardless of their actual balances? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Pool Info Staleness] At lines 48-62, incentive::get_pool_info is called with a pool address—if the pool data has been updated after the address was retrieved, can stale data be returned to users? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Pool Object Vector Manipulation] At line 269, incentive::get_pool_objects returns all pool objects—if this vector is extremely large, can it cause gas exhaustion or DoS when iterating through all pools? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Asset-Option Pool Filtering] At line 37, get_pool_from_asset_and_option filters pools—if an attacker creates many matching pools, can this cause the function to iterate through excessive pools and hit gas limits? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Reward Calculation Inconsistency] At line 65, calculate_one_from_pool uses current timestamp 'now'—if the pool's rewards have been claimed more recently than 'now' due to clock inconsistency, can total_rewards_of_user be less than already-claimed rewards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Reward Double Counting] At line 312, calculate_one_from_pool is called for each pool—if a user is counted in multiple pools for the same asset due to phase transitions, can rewards be double-counted? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools()] [Total Supply Zero] At line 65, if total_supply_balance is 0 (no one has supplied/borrowed), can the reward calculation divide by zero or return incorrect per-user rewards? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: insert_pools()] [Phase Collision] At lines 344-348, if two pools have the same phase value, they're grouped together—if phase values are not unique per time period, can this cause pools from different epochs to be incorrectly combined? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: insert_pools()] [Loop Logic Error] At lines 343-353, the loop continues even after finding a matching phase (line 350 sets is_exist but continues loop)—can this cause the same pool info to be inserted multiple times if multiple phase groups match? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: insert_pools()] [Vector Mutation Race] At line 350, 'vector::push_back(&mut element.pools, *info)' mutates a borrowed vector element—if element reference is invalidated during push_back, can this cause memory corruption? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/incentive.move] [Function: get_incentive_pools_group_by_phase()] [Phase Ordering] At line 332, insert_pools is called but phases may not be ordered—can unordered phases confuse users about chronological progression of incentive programs?
